fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 - Jira Service Desk does not render email invites upon issue creation
 - Upon sending email invites from Skype to Jira Service Desk email, the details of the email invite is not being parsed.
 - Only the Skype link is being shown in the description in Jira Service Desk but no other details.

h3. Suggested Solution
 - Allow to parse calendar invites from Skype to Jira Service Desk

h3. Workaround
 - N/A
fields.summary: Allow parsing of email calendar invites for Skype to Jira Service Desk

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

When configuring the approver's source in a JSD workflow, the field *Team* (from Portfolio) is displayed as a possible option:
 !Screen Shot 2018-04-26 at 3.34.00 PM.png|thumbnail! 

But it will cause problems with the approval functionality.
It will display a warning in the approvals's field value:
 !Screen Shot 2018-04-26 at 3.37.22 PM.png|thumbnail! 

It won't work even if you install Portfolio, create a shared team and populate the team field. It is expected since it won't be possible to take the users (as values) from the Team's field value, which is a totally different type of value:
 !Screen Shot 2018-04-26 at 3.36.34 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the project settings in a JSD project -> *Workflows* -> click on the en icon to edit a workflow;
 # While in diagram mode, click on a status and check *Add approvers*;
 # Still in the same window, click on *Configure* (next to Add approvers) -> select the *Team* option in the *Get approvers from*
 field -> publish the workflow;
 # Create an issue, and transition it to the status where the approvers are set.

h3. Results

There is a warning saying that there are no approvers selected.

h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Portfolio's Team field is a possible option for selecting approvers.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If project setting not allow customers to search another customer by email, when adding Approvers, cannot add one by entering email for the customers 
 with "QM" generic number as customer username.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure your project doesn't have autocomplete on the approver field in the customer portal (i.e. turn 'Who can customers share requests with?' option in Customer permissions to 'Other customers in their org'.
 # Create a new customer account and make sure the username have the customer account id (qm:xxxx)
 # Then , login to Customer Portal with another customer account.
 # Make sure the form have Approvals field , then add the newly created account as approval. Use the customer email.

h3. Expected Results

Successfully add the customer as approvals.
h3. Actual Results

Display error :-
{noformat}
Could not find usernames: test2@some.com
{noformat}
!Screen Shot 2018-04-26 at 9.48.58 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

This behaviour may also occur in other locations - e.g. mentions in comments, and the participants field.
h3. Workaround
 # Change project settings to allow customers see other's emails (i.e. turn 'Who can customers share requests with?' option in Customer permissions to 'Other customers in their org'.); or
 # The agent need to add the approvals from JIRA; or
 # Use the username (QM id); or
 # Migrate the customer account to Atlassian Account. Then , edit the username to email.
fields.summary: Cannot add Approvers on the Customer Portal

fields.description:
Currently, if an email is sent to JSD to create an issue from a meeting request or other invitation, JSD ticket doesn't reflect that in the issue. Technically, as all the invite content is only in “meta” content of the email, not in the body. JSD do not parse the calendar invites or others. But calendar invites possibly work if they’re in the body of the email.

It would be very useful to have these invites parsed by JSD and made part of the resulting issue created.
fields.summary: Parse meta content of email to include invitations details in JSD issues

fields.description:
Many times we well receive a service request from someone who is an IT Contractor for one of our customers. They'll identify what company they are calling on behalf of and we'll work with them. 

It would be ideal if we could have a feature, such as a little edit button next to the reporter's name, that would allow us the ability to add them to the organization that they're contracting for right from the ticket. It would be much easier than having to do it manually from the customer/organization list, which many times doesn't get done. 

This in combination with [JSDCLOUD-4519|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4519] would make our workflow much easier as well as improve reporting accuracy.

Thanks so much.
fields.summary: Have the option to add a customer to an organization right from the ticket.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a Customer adds an Agent to their request as a participant, that agent is subsequently treated as a Customer for the purposes of triggering SLAs with events like "Comment: for customer"

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement a way to restrict Customer's abilities to add Agents as Request Participants, or, treat Customer-added Agents differently in some other way to avoid this problem. 


h3. Workaround 
Ask Agents to manually remove themselves from being a *Request Participant* before acting further in order to have their events be fired/processed as intended.
fields.summary: As a Service Desk Admin I would like to be able to restrict Customers from adding Agents to Requests as Participants

fields.description: tasks is not generated through email but able to create by using panel on particular project .Required urgent help to fix this .
fields.summary: tasks not generated by email

fields.description:
Issue:

Unlike an incident report, you cannot display a scheduled maintenance event until it is in progress. 

 

Requirement: 

Add an option while creating a scheduled maintenance event to allow it to be shown on the portal so customers are being warned about the maintenance.
fields.summary: Status page add-on does not display scheduled maintenance events

fields.description:
Status page add-on tries to load in the Help Center event if there is no status to be displayed. This causes pages to load a little awkward by pushing the content down and then bringing it back up.

 

!Screen Shot 2018-04-24 at 17.23.29 (2).png!

Expected behaviour:

The page will load fine without attempting to show any status.
fields.summary: Status page add-on tries to load in the Help Center event if there is no status to be displayed.

fields.description:
h3. Description

When selecting the calendar hours on the SLA configuration, the hour fields are being cut out by the browser, and the user can't know what is the exactly hour that he selected without dropping down the hour list and seeing what hour is missing from there.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up a new Calendar or edit one inside the SLA settings of a Service Desk Project
 # Edit the calendar and add a new work week by selecting the start and end hours of the day

h3. Expected Results

The user should know what is the hour that he selected from the dropdown list
h3. Actual Results

They can't know the hour that is selected, without looking the whole dropdown list and then finding out what hour is missing from there.
h3. Notes

Tested on Chrome 65.0.3325.181 on Mac and Windows
 Tested on Firefox 59.02 on Mac

See attachment.
fields.summary: Hour picker on SLA Calendar is being truncated

fields.description: Every time a new customer sign up to our customer portal ( we enabled anyone to send requests) we would like to get an email / notification it happened - even if the customer didn't log in.
fields.summary: Get email alert when new customer sign up to customer portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3442].
{panel}
The "Create with shared configuration" currently take over the following configurations when creating a new project:
 * Permission Scheme
 * Notification Scheme
 * Issue Security Scheme
 * Workflow Scheme
 * Issue Type Scheme
 * Issue Type Screen Scheme
 * Field Configuration Scheme

For Service Desk projects though it is very convenient to have Request Types, SLAs and Queues implemented in this function as well. In particular in situations where Agents have default SLAs and Queues they must create every time a project is created.

As well as all other settings like request types etc.
fields.summary: Incorporate JSD Settings into the "create with shared configuration" option: - SLA, Queue,Automation etc

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently the "Email confirmation to" is located at the bottom of the Create Request portal and cannot be moved/ordered differently.
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow ordering the field.
h3. Why this is important
By allowing admins to order the location of the field would allow admins to determine which important field should be displayed first
fields.summary: Allow ordering the "Email confirmation to" field in the Customer Portal

fields.description:
At the moment, KB articles linked to a Service Desk project can only be accessed through the Search tool or through keywords when typing out a Summary on the create issue screen.

It would be ideal for a list of KB articles to be readily available within the Service Desk project itself from the front page, without the customer needing to type anything beforehand
fields.summary: Allow KB Articles to be Displayed Directly in the Customer Portal

fields.description: exporting to CSV loses the ability to have hyperlinks on the Jira incidents.  Please bring this feature back!
fields.summary: JIRA v7.6.4 - no longer can export to Excel
Add Request Type as Field in the Create Issue Screen

fields.description:
h3. Description

Automation show as executed even when a customer does not have permission to execute the action.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up an automation rule to create a new ticket on a customer comment
 # Set the automation to be run as *User who triggered the rule*.
 # Comment on the ticket with a portal only customer

h3. Expected Results

The automation logs should show an error message on the UI
h3. Actual Results

The rule shows as executed, but no ticket is created.
h3. Notes

See attachment.
fields.summary: Automation show as executed even when a customer does not have permission to execute the action

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The "Jira Service Desk" menu sometimes doesn't load in User management.

h3. Environment

User Management.

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Access the User management;
# The menu sometimes doesn't load;
 !Screen Shot 2018-04-23 at 12.29.57.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2018-04-23 at 12.30.20.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected results

The menu always is shown.

h3. Actual result

The menu sometimes doesn't load.

h3. Workaround

Reload the page until it appears.
fields.summary: Missing "Jira Service Desk" menu from user management

fields.description:
I have to configure custom mailbox which in Jira service desk cloud. For this configuration do I have to verify our domain? I have gone through this documents,

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/domain-verification-873871234.html#Domainverification-Verifyyourdomain]

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-jira-cloud-to-send-emails-on-behalf-of-your-domain-900996548.html]

Do i have any another way to configure my email id on Atlassian cloud? because our technical team are not allowing to configure their domain on Atlassian Cloud.

Kindly, provide the solution for this issue ASAP.
fields.summary: Configuration of mailbox on Atlassian Cloud

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

In order to mention a customer in the a request in the customer portal, it is necessary to use [~'username']. But since the customer migration, the username is a global id, which causes it to be not user friendly when performing the action.

See the example: 
 !Screen Shot 2018-04-23 at 8.34.45 AM.png|thumbnail! 

With the customer migration, it should be possible to mention the customer using the e-mail address, which is not working in the moment.

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In the request page (portal view), type [~'e-mail address'], and click on add. It won't have any result;
 # Now, try [~'username'] (the id). This is the only way to have it work currently.


h3. Expected Results
It should be possible to mention the customer using [~e-mail address].

h3. Actual Results
It is necessary to use the full id.

h3. Workaround

Using the id will have the mention function work.
fields.summary: It is necessary to use the customers's id in order to mention them in the portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When exporting issues to Excel(CSV), if the reporter is a customer, the CSV file is displaying the customer's QM code, such as *qm:<customer_id>*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Search for issues
# Export issues to CSV

h3. Expected Results
* JIRA should export the customer's email address to the CSV file.

h3. Actual Results
* JIRA is exporting the customer's qm code to the CSV file.
fields.summary: Jira exports no longer show personally identifiable ids in CSV export

fields.description: After the JIRA system has changed to Atlassian, we cannot find previous issues which we created in the old system. Where can we find them?
fields.summary: Cannot find issues of previous system

fields.description:
Create a new role of customers inside an organization in JIRA Service Desk.

This role would have extra notification options such as the option to be always notified about any new issue raised for customers inside the same organization.
fields.summary: Customer Notifications - main contacts for each organization.

fields.description: I believe this is also an accessibility issue, but in general this is terrible and tremendously frustrating. Also, I have no idea which Jira I'm supposed to complain to, y'all have way too many names that kinda mean the same thing. I looked up "About Jira" on the Jira app I'm using, and it just says "Jira Service Desk Application", nothing about whether it's cloud or server (which as far as I'm concerned sound like the same thing?)
fields.summary: links need to open in a new tab by default, especially if it takes me away from Jira
Replace qm <code> with Email Address When A Customer is Mentioned in the Comment

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the obvious knowledge based search bar is display in "Help Center" page. 
 !Screen Shot 2018-04-20 at 4.55.42 PM.png|thumbnail! 

On project customer portal page , customer needs to use the magnifying glass icon , beside their avatar.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the knowledge-based search bar for every project customer portal.
fields.summary: Make Knowledge Based search bar in every Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary
SInce 7th March 2018 , based on JIRA Service Desk blog post (https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/blog/2017/12/knowledge-bases-must-be-on-the-same-domain-as-your-service-desk) , Jira Service Desk Cloud will no longer support links to:

* Confluence Server
* Confluence Cloud spaces hosted on a different domain

And it also updated in [Serving customers with a knowledge base|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/serving-customers-with-a-knowledge-base-732528995.html#Servingcustomerswithaknowledgebase-linkLinkaConfluencespace]. However, if the instance already have application link to Confluence with a different domain , and try to configure the knowledge based , it throws misleading error. 


h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create application link to Confluence with different domain
# Go to JIRA Service Desk project , try to configure the knowledge based 

h3. Expected Results
It throws user friendly error :-
You can only link to Confluence spaces that are on the same domain as your service desk project.

h3. Actual Results
It throw error below:-

{noformat}
Can't connect to Confluence because the application link is corrupt. Recreated the Confluence link in Application Links, and then try again.
{noformat}
 
 !Screen Shot 2018-04-20 at 3.42.15 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Migrate the Confluence content to the same domain with JIRA Service Desk project as per explain [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/blog/2017/12/knowledge-bases-must-be-on-the-same-domain-as-your-service-desk] . Then configure the knowledge based again.
fields.summary: Misleading error when link Knowledge base with different domain

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*

Currently, when a customer is only given access to one customer portal or by default if the help center has only one customer portal, the customer gets a default redirection to the customer portal page with the portal number in the URL. 

On the other hand, if the customer is apart of multiple customer portal or if all the customer portal are made public, the customer is redirected to the help center by default. 

There is no way to set the default to the help center regardless of if the customer is apart of one customer portal or all the customer portal.
h3. *Why This is Important*

Allow the Jira administrator to configure the customer portal and help center redirection to tailor to the customers experience.
fields.summary: Ability to Configure the Help Center to be the Default Redirection

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a portal only customer accesses their profile, they are allowed to change their avatar by redirecting to http://en.gravatar.com/
h3. Suggested Solution
Option to disable this redirection
h3. Why this is important
Customer would be directed to third party sites which is not manageable and could cause confusion to the customer
fields.summary: Disable gravatar redirection

fields.description:
*Summary*

When you try to search for an Atlassian Account customer who belongs to an Organization in the Customer tab field, the search results does not include that user. 

*Steps to Reproduce*
 # Create an Atlassian Account user and a Portal Only Customer user
 # Go to the Service Desk Project > Open the Customer Tab > Create an Organization and add both of these users. 
 # In the Customer Tab Search Bar > Search for the portal only customer > The search result will show the portal only customer with the *Organization* as a tag on the name.
 # In the Customer Tab Search Bar > Search for the Atlassian Account customer > the search result will be empty.

 

*Expected Results*

Able to use the Customer tab Search Bar to search for all types of customer, whether it is a Service Desk agent with a customer account, a portal-only customer account or an Atlassian Account customer that belongs in an *Organizations*.  

*Actual Results*

Able to use the Customer tab Search Bar to only search for  portal-only customer account that belongs in an *Organizations*.
fields.summary: Atlassian Account Customers in Organization cannot be searched via Search Bar in Customer Page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, based on [JIRA Service Desk REST API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/] documentation , {{GET /rest/servicedeskapi/knowledgebase/article}} API need authentication. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide anonymous permission to retrieve article for knowledge based if the space is open to Anonymous.

h3. Why this is important
As we allow the customer to view knowledge based without log in, so it should be able to do it via REST API.
fields.summary: Allow "Get Article" REST API for anonymous access

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If a customer is a member of an Organization, raising a ticket through the JSD Widget, it is not possible to automatically share the ticket with the Organization.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the widget the ability to share the ticket to the customer's Organization.

h3. Why this is important
When an existing user uses the widget, the ticket can be shared with other people from the organization, without the need of agents to do manual work.
fields.summary: When raising a ticket through Widget, provide the ability to share the ticket with the user's Organization

fields.description: It would be nice to have a built-in profanity filter for service issues created via email or through portal. To automatically censor swear words by some means. For instance, putting **** in place of censored with or simply replace with <text_replaced>.
fields.summary: Profanity filter for service desk issues
Creating SLA Goals Using Quotes For Organization Gives Irregular Results

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The customer can't load the automation screen.

h3. Environment

Jira Service Desk Automation.

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Go to any Service Desk project;
# Click on the automation settings;
# The page never loads.

h3. Expected results

Page loads and show the automation rules.

h3. Actual result

The page keeps spinning.

h3. Workaround

Contact Atlassian support.
fields.summary: Automation screen doesn't load

fields.description:
Currently, Jira SD has only one customer notification scheme and all customers will receive the same notification template.
It would be great if we could have multiple custom email addresses as reported on JSDCLOUD-798 and with this, we could have the ability to edit notifications based on the customers' domain.
fields.summary: Ability to edit notifications based on the customers' domain

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In JSD (Jira Service Desk) it is possible to unsubscribe from notifications of a specific issue.
You can do it via JSD Portal:

!image-2018-04-15-10-48-23-600.png|width=608,height=208!  

This setting is not taken into account when JSD notification helper is used.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JSD issue
 # Click 'Don't notify me' via JSD Portal
 # Check notifications for this issue via "Notification Helper"

 

It would be great to have this setting included in "Notification Helper" list.
fields.summary: Notification helper should take into account "Don't notify me" option for each ticket in JSD

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When request type is being used for e-mail, apart from "summary" and "description", it's not possible to change other fields to required. No errors are presented to UI when this occurs causing user confusion.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Go to request type configuration of a request type that is used as e-mail, mark a field other than "summary" / "description" as required.

*Expected:* An error explaining to user that no other fields than "summary" and "description" can be marked required for e-mail request-type

*Actual:* Nothing happens when the "save" button is pressed causing confusion
h3. Workaround

Use a different request-type for e-mail. By design only "Summary" and "Description" can be marked as required in an e-mail request type.
fields.summary: Marking fields as required produces no error in Request type used for e-mail

fields.description:
*At the moment* Jira Service desk only allows creating one layer of Groups for Request Types;
!Screen Shot 2018-01-25 at 11.41.29 am.png|width=541,height=208!

So currently there only 2 layers - Group and Request Types inside the groups.

What is being suggested in this feature request is that there are 3 layers, so that Customers are able to nest Groups and Request Types inside upper level Groups as follows:
!图片.png!
fields.summary: Allow creating nested Request Types and Request Type Groups to show in customer portal
Email notification images not showing in Windows OS Outlook

fields.description:
Hi,

We are using the latest version of Jira Service Desk on-site and we would like to offer the customers to filter for more fields, like the selected {{fixVersion}} or {{affectedVersion}}.

Additionally, we would like to be able to configure which fields should be shown to the customer. E.g. {{affectedVersion}} is currently shown but I am not able to add the {{fixVersion}}.

Best regards,
   Carsten Franke
fields.summary: Extend customer's abilities to search and filter tickets

fields.description: Can the Service Desk system create a "parent" request that is made of up several individual requests. For example, we have a request form we complete when a new employee is hired. At that time we need to request a security badge, a workstation to be assigned, a computer be provided, network access, etc. By selecting a request such as "New Employee Request", could the system somehow create the sub-tasks so that the core information wouldn't have to be repeated (name, start date, location, etc.). Each sub-task could then be handled separately but associated to the parent task.
fields.summary: Parent Service Request with multiple child requests

fields.description:
I would like to setup a different look&feel for different portals related to different service desk project but as I see there is just one big portal loo and feel.

Is it something that I can do but I do not know how or it could be an improvement?

 

thanks
fields.summary: different look&feel for different portals

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Service Desk agents are unable to create tickets on behalf of existing customers via Service Desk REST API.

The JIRA Service Desk API expects the customer's username on the *"raiseOnBehalfOf"* parameter, however, due to a recent change on the Portal Only accounts, the customer's username no longer matches the user's email address, which is commonly used as the value of *"raiseOnBehalfOf"*.

h3. Environment

This bug mainly affects users who have set their own web form to create tickets on JIRA Service Desk via API.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1 - Create Service Desk request using the command below. Replace the IDs accordingly:

{code}
curl -D- --request POST \
  --user agent@domain.com:<API_Token> \
  --header 'Accept: application/json' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data '
    {
      "serviceDeskId": "sd-id",
      "requestTypeId": "requestypeid",
      "raiseOnBehalfOf": "inexisten-address@domain.com",
      "requestFieldValues": {
        "summary": "Request JSD help via REST",
        "description": "I need a new *mouse* for my Mac"
      }
          }' \
  --url 'https://site.atlassian.net/rest/servicedeskapi/request'{code}

2 - Repeat the same command.

h3. Expected Results

You'll have two tickets created on your Service Desk.

h3. Actual Results

The first call will create both the customer account and the Service Desk request, while the second call will return the following error:

{noformat}
{"errorMessage":"Your request could not be created. Please check the fields have been correctly filled in. Please provide a valid value for field 'Raise this request on behalf of'","i18nErrorMessage":{"i18nKey":"sd.validation.request.creation.failure.required.field","parameters":["Please provide a valid value for field 'Raise this request on behalf of'"]}} {noformat}
 
h3. Notes

At the moment, this only affects new Service Desk customers whose usernames are stored in a "hash" format.  Accounts that the username and email address match each other are not affected by the bug.

h3.Workaround
None at the moment
fields.summary: Service Desk API won't create tickets on behalf of existing customers

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Project admin would like to edit the "Raise this request on behalf of" syntax to another text.
 !Screen Shot 2018-04-12 at 11.03.16.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Create the ability to edit the text "Raise this request on behalf of" to the project admin.
fields.summary: Ability to edit the field "Raise this request on behalf of"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When an assignee belongs to the organization which the request is shared with, the assignee is treated as a customer and would not receive internal comment notifications. 
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the assignee to receive internal comment notifications although they belong to the organization.
h3. Why this is important
 In an in-house support system where all requests get created by internal users and all the agents are internal users belongs to the same organization causes all internal users when being an assignee to be treated as a customer and would not receive notifications for internal comments. Changing the *Should customers receive Jira notifications?* to *Yes, send customers both Jira Service Desk and Jira notifications* is a global config will cause internal users who are acting as a reporter/request participant/organization member to receive duplicate notifications.
fields.summary: Allow agents to receive notification although they belong to an organization.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition:
At the moment, the section "Related Knowledge-based article" section is only available for JIRA Service Desk. But, it would great if the feature is available for other project types where in standard JIRA tickets it would show the related Confluence Pages that match the summary of the ticket such as internal procedure related to the ticket or internal developer notes.

h3. Suggested Solution:
To have the same feature available in other Project Types where it will show related Confluence Pages before it is linked manually.
fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk "Related Knowledge Based" to be available in other Project Types

fields.description:
h3. Summary  

Some parts of Jira Service Desk are not being translated to German
h3. Environment

Default language, Project, indexing language, browser, all of these are set to German, but under "Customers" page in Jira Service Desk project some parts are not translated at all. This is also true for Issue's info on the right-hand side fields. Both cases can be seen in the next screenshots:
 !Screenshot 2018-04-11 20.56.00.png|thumbnail! 
 *Customer Page*

!Screenshot 2018-04-11 21.02.12.jpg|thumbnail! 
 *Issue Details*
h3. Steps to Reproduce

'Customers' page
 # Change the Default Language to German
 # Change the project's Language to German
 # Change the Browser's Language to German
 # Change the indexing Language to German
 # Access A Service Desk project and click "Customer"

'Issue Details'
 # Access an issue created through the customer portal

h3. Expected Results
 * Even translation throughout this all pages in Jira

h3. Actual Results
 * Missing translations to German
fields.summary: German missing translation in Jira Service Desk

fields.description:
Using Jira v5.0.112 on Android I'm not able to approve requests through the app as the option to approve is not visible like in browser.

Adding the option to the mobile version of the Jira would make the approval process even easier.
fields.summary: As a user, I want to be able to approve requests through the mobile app

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, if you have a custom field with multiple options, it's not possible to translate the custom field options for the idioms configured under 'Language support'. It's only possible to translate the name of the field and its description.

h3. Suggested Solution

As an admin, I would like to be able to translate all field options for each language I have set for the customer portal.
fields.summary: Ability to translate custom field options under Language support

fields.description:
When someone changed the Portal user page, they have reset all my Deactivated accounts to be Active again.
Anyone with thousands of customers is going to be very VERY annoyed at this.
fields.summary: Don't Reactivate Users, After Update in the Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Portal-only user activity does not show activity under the user profile. (/secure/ViewProfile.jspa)

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# create a servicedesk project
# Create a new portal-only user under that project
# As that user, log into the portal and create a new issue.

h3. Expected Results

The issue shows under the user activity.

h3. Actual Results

No user activity for that user is shown.

h3. Notes
N/A

h3.Workaround
At this time there is no workaround
fields.summary: Portal only user activity is not shown in their profile page

fields.description:
h3.Summary

The date time picker field, if set as a hidden field (with default date and time), returns error if the user's is 'portugese(portugal)'.

h3.Steps to Replicate
# Create a test date time picker custom field.
# Add the field to the project screen.
# Create a request type and then add this date field to the screen.
# Hide this field and set a default value to it.
# Change your preferred language at your user profile to 'portugese(portugal)'.
# Create a request with the request type at step 3.

h3.Expected Results
Request gets created without errors.

h3.Current Results
Request creation hits into error. 

{noformat}
This form contains a hidden field that does not have a valid default value configured.
{noformat}

h3.Workaround

Change the preferred language in the user profile to English.
fields.summary: Hidden date time picker field returning error if user preferred language is 'portugese(portugal)'

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently when an email is sent to the email request to create a request, the Request Created notification will be sent to the customers involved as a new thread instead of a reply to the sent email.
h3. Suggested Solution
Send the Request Created email notification into the same email thread as the sent email which creates the request.
h3. Why this is important
It is more natural for all the users involved to use the first thread instead of another which is initialized by Jira
fields.summary: Send Request Created as a reply to the initial email sent which generates the request.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The "Forgot your password?" feature from Customer Portal is sending a hash number where the email address should be on the recovery email body, this affects portal-only users trying to recover their account, it causes a bit of confusion but does not affect functionality.

h3. Caused by
The usernames of portal-only users is being changed to an external identifier, this is part of Atlassian's commitment to become compliant with GDPR policies in the near future.

Read [Atlassian and GDPR – Our commitment to data privacy|https://www.atlassian.com/blog/announcements/atlassian-and-gdpr-our-commitment-to-data-privacy] for more information.
fields.summary: The "Forgot your password?" feature from Customer Portal is sending a hash number where the email address should be on the recovery email body.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
With the customer migration, now portal customers have a global unique id as username.

When performing an advanced search (JQL), Jira will search the portal customers by the e-mail address.
But the problem is that once you click on the e-mail address to add it to the search field, Jira will add the username (now and id) to the search field.

This is not user friendly since the id is a long string, taking a good part of the search field:
 !Screen Shot 2018-04-06 at 2.05.27 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Perform a JQL search (e.g. *reporter = customer...*):
  ** Notice that Jira will find the email address:
   !Screen Shot 2018-04-06 at 2.07.13 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 ** But once you click on the email address, jira will add the id to the search field:
   !Screen Shot 2018-04-06 at 2.05.27 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Jira should add the email address to the user field.

h3. Actual Results
Jira will display the customer's id.


h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: JQL search including portal customers will display the account id in the search field instead of the e-mail

fields.description:
h3. Description

In some scenarios, customers would like to create a few organizations and it would be nice to have an option to create all of them at once.

If the REST API call could receive a list of names instead of a string it would be helpful for this scenario.
 * [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/#api-organization-post]
fields.summary: Create mutiple organizations at once

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Attachments added to the Issue Description throw a '403 forbidden' error when viewed by Service Desk Customers.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue on a Service Desk project. (Make sure that it has a valid request type)
# As a Service Desk agent, edit the issue description, adding and linking an attachment on it. [ˆattachment]
# As a Customer, open the ticket on the portal.
# Click on the attachment link.

h3. Expected Results

The attachment is previewed/downloaded.

h3. Actual Results
The following error is displayed to the customer:

{color:red}Encountered a "403 - Forbidden" error while loading this page.
{color}

h3.Workaround
Link the attachment on a new comment.
fields.summary: 403 error when viewing attachments as a Customer

fields.description: I, as Jira Admin, would like to have the automations translated to other languages, based on the customers browser, for example.
fields.summary: Translate Automations Based on Users Default Language

fields.description:
The "in-app help" tab on the right corner is overlapping the right arrow to browse the images attached to an issue.
 # Open an issue with multiple attachments.
 # open an attachment to visualize it
 # the "in-app help" tab overlaps the right arrow
fields.summary: When viewing images on a ticket that has more than one, the right browse arrow is mostly obscured by the in-app Help tab

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customers do not receive notification/updates on their open requests and need to manually access portal to view their requests.
h3. Suggested Solution
Create a weekly/monthly report to notify customers on their open requests.
h3. Why this is important
At the moment, there is no feature to allow customers to receive a report/notification of their open issues hence they are not updated. Customers would need to manually access the portal and view their list of open requests. Having the ability to generate a weekly report would update the customer of what is still pending and if any input is required on their side.
fields.summary: Allow customers to receive a report on their open issues on a weekly/monthly time basis
Suggested KB articles in Portal overlap field help text

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JSD customers notifications are not sent in the language configurated as default in the project

h3. Environment
* Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure JIRA instance default language to one language (i.e., English);
# Configure another language as the default language for the service desk project (e.g., german/spanish).
# Open a request through support mail address from an email with no account associated to it (new account).

h3. Expected Results
All notifications regarding the open issue being sent in service desk project default language e.g., German/Spanish.

h3. Actual Results
All notifications regarding this issue are sent in the instance default language (English).
 
h3. Notes
* As the user had not configured a language in his profile, it is expected that the default project language be used;
* The language used for the initial notifications is independent of the customer's browser language.

h3.Workaround
* No workaround known.
fields.summary: Customer notifications are not sent in project default language

fields.description:
Activities done by the automation are registered as being performed by a real user.

This means no one can actually see if the user or the automation has executed the action. 
The Client Portal and the automation log is showing "Automation" or admin and hiding the actual user. But at almost all other locations the user in context is simply listed.

To resolve this requires having a system account for the automation to execute in instead of requiring a Users Context for the automation.
fields.summary: Automation Log shows "admin", but in Transition shows the Trigger Name

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In a support environment where a huge number of organization is supported, setting up Queues, SLA and Automation can be a hassle as each JQL for a condition/goal has to contain all the organizations names to ensure that the Queues, SLA or Automation to work as intended.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow grouping organizations according to tiers.

h3. Why this is important
If the customer organization are in the same tier, grouping them together would assist configuring the JQL as instead of entering all the required organization, an admin would only enter the required "organization group" where all of the organization for the specific group/tier are equal. For a growing customer base, the JQL configured would not need to be edited when a new organization is added as to a group/tier as adding that customer organization group/tier would allow the new organization to have the correct SLA/automation/queue.
fields.summary: Allow grouping customer organization

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*

i.) Currently, you can only set one default message for the Front Page Title.

The user wants the ability to edit the *Front Page Title* in the: [https://instanceurl.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portals?customize=true] based on the customer's language profile, so that the welcome message can be customized to the customer's own supported language. 


ii.) Currently, in each portal the *Help Center Name* will remain the same.

The user wants the ability to edit the *Help Center Name* in the: [https://instanceurl.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portals?customize=true] based on the customer's language profile, so that the help center name can be customized to the customer's own supported language and show a different link to click to the Help Center. 
h3. *Why This is Important*

It's more personalized and feels very welcoming when the header follows the customer native language, it's a great way to showcase a friendly and pro multi-lingual Service Desk experience for the customers.
fields.summary: Ability to Customize Help Center Links & Text Based on User Profile Language

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the Open/Closed requests in *Customers* tab is using a default JQL, and it is not possible to edit the JQL for the organizations/customers Open/Closed requests. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the option to edit the JQL for the organizations/customers Open/Closed requests.
fields.summary: Ability to edit the JQL for an organization's Open/Closed requests

fields.description:
I do reporting of "Customer Satisfaction" and "Created vs Resolved" and have come across a problem where Chrome and Firefox behave differently.

Chrome is my preferred browser. Firefox is next. I also checked in Opera which behaves link Chrome.
 * In Chrome, when I copy from the "Customer Satisfaction" report and the "Comment" column is blank, pasting into Excel pastes the first line a column short. I.e. the issue "Key" appears over the following rows "Rating" column. I do not copy the column headers as there is usually a issue or two the fall outside what I am copying, and I paste into a template table in Excel.
 * Firefox on the other hand behaves as expected and the "Key" appears in the correct column for the first row.

On the other hand, the "Created vs Resolved" behaves in the reverse manner.
 * When selecting the days and created/resolved columns (again, not including the header) you can see that the figures for the created/resolved columns is selected.
 * In Firefox, the figures are not highlighted, only the days.

In both of the above cases I would expect both pages to behave the same.

I subsequently tested Microsoft IE and Microsoft Edge and found that they behave correctly with both reports.

 

The attached file ([^CopyIssue.xlsx]) includes demonstrations of the above and which browsers behaved in which way. A separate tab includes the versions of each browser tested.
fields.summary: Copy and "paste as text" from JIRA cloud behaves differently between browsers

fields.description:
Problem: User is not able to see who Create/updated/delete workflow status.

Suggestion: Audit Log should display who (user) Create/updated/delete workflow status.
fields.summary: Audit log should register log of Create/updated/delete workflow status

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA allows service desk agents to convert Portal request to sub-tasks.
This results in a sub-task issue type being displayed at the customer portal which is not expected as per [JIRA Service Desk: Sub\-Tasks|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confeval/jira-service-desk-evaluator-resources/jira-service-desk-sub-tasks]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a service desk project
# Add the sub-task issue type to that project
# Raise a request through the customer portal
# Convert the request to a sub-task with the {{Convert to sub-task}} function:
 !convert.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

JIRA should display a warning mentioning that portal request can't be converted to sub-task

h3. Actual Results

The request is converted and the customer ends up with a sub-task with a request type:
 !subbug.png|thumbnail! 
 !portal.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround

Convert the issue back to a valid request type.
fields.summary: JIRA allows the conversion a request to a sub-task and it is still displayed at the portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
After the tickets are resolved, an email with the customer satisfaction survey (CSAT) is sent to the customers. However, not all the customers take the time to fill in this survey and there are no settings to force existing customers to fill in this survey.

h3. Suggested Solution

Ability to change the JSD settings so that customers cannot open new tickets if previous surveys are not filled in.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround.
fields.summary: Customers cannot open new tickets if previous surveys are not filled in

fields.description: I'm auditing the JSD Server doc space and discovered that in the tutorial, a few issue types were being referenced (Access, Purchase) that don't come with the templates for server anymore (boooooo). Wazza and I then did a bit more digging around issues types to see what else had changed and we saw that the Issue types and issue types schemes section on [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/default-service-desk-project-configuration-776636295.html] was out of date too.
fields.summary: default jsd project config page is out of date

fields.description:
To reproduce

1. A portal-only user(customer) adds sensitive/personal information while raising a ticket in a Service Desk project.
2. A JSD agent identifies that the ticket has sensitive/personal information and removes the information from the ticket. 
3. Ticket history shows the update with the old (sensitive information) 

Please allow agents to remove entries from the issue history.
fields.summary: Allow agents to delete entries from issue history
JSD portal-only customers that are converted to Atlassian Account are wrongly imported as portal-only customers

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, it's not possible to hide the option "Did this article help?" in articles suggested at Customer Portal.
h3. Suggested solution

Provide the ability for Jira administrator to hide this option.
fields.summary: Ability to hide "Did this article help?" option of Knowledge base in Portal

fields.description:
We are using both, JIRA Software and JIRA Service Desk. We also are visualizing our service desk tickets on a Software Kanban board.

We would like to have the possibility to locate those boards from Software projects to Service Desk Project, instead of only located in the user's profile.
fields.summary: Ability to locate Software Kanban-Boards in Service Desk Projects
Add Time Stamp to comments along with date stamp.

fields.description: The ability for the administrator to add the Search Bar for each individual service desk projects portals, similar to the search bar on the Help Center.
fields.summary: Ability to add the Search Bar for each individual service desk project

fields.description:
h3. Problem:

Currently in the 'Time in Status' automation there is not a way to specify business days/hours. 
When you use this status to close tickets or move them to an inactive queue it can cause issues over the weekend

h3. Desired Fix:
Add an option under the time section in the automation to select business days
Screenshot below to show example
fields.summary: Add business days to time in status automation
raiseOnBehalfOf field can accept email address instead of customer account id when creating issue via REST API

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When change customer profile language to *português (Portugal)* , there's a few words is not translated correctly. It's still displaying in English.
h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open customer profile from Customer Portal.
# Change the language to *português (Portugal)*.


h3. Expected Results
All translated correctly
h3. Actual Results
There's a few senteces still display in English :-
* Alterar a password
* Update your account details through Atlassian Account
* Edit preferences
As per screenshot below:-
 !Screen Shot 2018-03-29 at 9.06.38 PM.png|thumbnail! 


h3.Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: Customer Portal not fully translated when using "português (Portugal)" language

fields.description:
Hi,

in our Jira Service Desk (project "Calzedonia Application Maintenance")

in the customer portal, the transition "reopen" from "User Acceptance Test" status doesn't work.

We see the comment screen, but the button "reopen" doesn't work.

Thanks
fields.summary: Transition doesn't work in customer Portal

fields.description:
In dialogs in the portal-only customers section of site admin, we still use the username instead of the email or display name.

The email is probably best to use here.
fields.summary: Use email instead of username in dialogs and flags in site admin

fields.description: The OAuth endpoints include specificity for an instance in the URL instead of being a generic URL that could be leveraged by a wider audience.
fields.summary: OAuth For Atlassian Accounts vs Specific JSD Instances

fields.description:
If a customer sends an issue with a link in it, the default behavior of Jira is to open in the active tab. This takes the support person away from Jira.

Please, configure this so that it will open in a new tab.
fields.summary: Open up links in new tabs

fields.description:
After the new UI came out, I could still hover and get to the registered users email addy, versus seeing the name they gave. Now, when I hover over, I don't see the email address any more, dunno who thought this was a good idea.

This is a problem as the name that I see in Jira, won't match the name they use in our platform, as will be for anyone else. I now have to click on the user to get to the user page to see the email address. Which takes even more time.
fields.summary: Please bring back email addresses when hovers over them

fields.description:
When one clicks on the magnifying glass to enter a search term, for whatever reason it does not faithfully accept Jira query language. It will bastardize the typical queries one might run, which then requires re-work, and wastes my time.

So, please, since you have added immensely to the workflow to simply get to the search screen, either have the pop-out search accept Jira Query Language or have a toggle for advanced users that allows us to do so.
fields.summary: Allow to use Jira Query Language in pop-out search

fields.description:
Update "Browse Projects" permission description to better represent the ability granted by this permission on Jira Service Desk projects.

An example would be replacing the current description:
"Ability to browse projects and the issues within them." 

To something more representative for Service Desk, such as:
"Ability for internal users to browse projects and the issues within them. Ability to browse the customer portal, and their respective issues, for external customers"

________________________

For "Service Desk Customer - Portal Access" access, the description should include some further explanation that when this permission is granted to "Browse Projects" customers will not be able to see all the issues in the projects, but instead, just the tickets created/watched by them. 

I'm suggesting this update in the descriptions of these two items as it may cause some security concerns for some customers.
fields.summary: Update "Browse Projects" permission and "Service Desk Customer - Portal Access" descriptions for Jira Service Desk projects

fields.description:
On the "Using JQL queries specific to SLAs" page, the end of the initial paragraph includes a link called "[Read more about JQL syntax|https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/~sirons/20160718+-+Notes+and+freewriting+for+reports+rewrite?_ga=2.250736910.989698388.1522079567-518475119.1504881618]" that points to an internally protected page ([https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/~sirons/20160718+-+Notes+and+freewriting+for+reports+rewrite?_ga=2.250736910.989698388.1522079567-518475119.1504881618)] that doesn't appear. 

This link appears in both Server and Cloud pages.
fields.summary: Broken Link on "Using JQL queries specific to SLAs"
Editing "sd.public.comment" comment property using REST API is not reflected in JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The new service desk customer portal search only returns 3 results per search.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a service desk project
# Create a knowledge base for it
# Create 4 pages or more starting with *How-to*
# Access the customer portal page and search for How-to

h3. Expected Results

The search should return all knowledge base pages containing how-to.

h3. Actual Results
 
It only returns 3 suggestions.

h3. Notes

This is just an example case but it's visible how much impact it can bring to service desks with big knowledge bases.
The ticket deflection will be highly affected by this problem as the customers must know the entire name of the knowledge base to find it.

h3.Workaround

Contact Atlassian Support sharing the impact that this is taking in your business.

h3. Suggestion

Implement a *view all results* or *view more* link.
fields.summary: New portal search only returns 3 results per search

fields.description:
h2.Summary

It will be nice if hidden request types can also be used for manual creation of customer requests. Currently it is possible to edit the screen of hidden request type and even open up the form for the request but when you try creating a request, it returns an error saying that the request type doesn't exist.

!request.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Allow hidden requests to have its own usability from the portal channel

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When adding fields to request types used by email for the customer portal it is not possible to configure the field 'components' as required.

h3. Environment
Vertigo

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Request Types
# Click on Edit fields for the email request type
# Add a field that is not summary or description to the request type
# Set the field components to required
# Try and save the settings and notice you cannot do anything


h3. Expected Results

There should be an error displayed that says

{noformat}
This request type is used by the email channel and Jira Service Desk cannot fill in field Component/s automatically from emails.
{noformat}


h3. Actual Results

The update button does not work and no error appears.
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
Leave the field as not required and give the field a default value on create. i.e. https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/default-component/qaq-p/454236
fields.summary: No error when setting a field as required for request types used by the email channel

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Translation missing for "Email confirmation to" in customer portal
h3. Environment

Vertigo
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Allow your Service Desk to accept requests without users logging in
 # Add another language and make it default
 # Change your profile language to the same default language used for project (to make sure profile settings are not over-riding)
 # Go to raise a request through the portal without logging in
 # Notice every field has a translation except for "Email request to"

h3. Expected Results

The field "Email request to" should also be translated
h3. Actual Results

The field is in (English OR Projects default language) regardless
h3. Notes
h3. Workaround

No known workaround
fields.summary: Translation missing for "Email confirmation to" in customer portal

fields.description:
(Valid for request types, components, custom field, etc.. anything that is used in the JQL that would have been removed as an available field / value leading to JQL being invalid at saving time). See that comment also for reference: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-5763?focusedCommentId=1669847&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-1669847

h3. Summary
When a user deleted a custom field, but the custom field exist in multiple report series JQL, admin couldn't edit the JQL it is because it still pointing to the deleted custom field. 

h3. Environment
* Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field. For example *ABC* field name.
 !Screen Shot 2018-03-26 at 6.39.29 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Then, open any JIRA Service Desk report. 
# Edit multiple of report series and add the field. For example for *Created* and *Resolved* series (Need to add the custom field JQL for few series) :-
 !Screen Shot 2018-03-26 at 6.43.39 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2018-03-26 at 6.40.13 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Then, go back to the custom field configuration and delete the field.
 !Screen Shot 2018-03-26 at 6.44.50 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Then, go back to the report series and edit the JQL.
h3. Expected Results
Admin able to edit the JQL.
h3. Actual Results
Not able to edit the JQL.
{noformat}
Field 'ABC' does not exist or you do not have permission to view it.
{noformat}
 !Screen Shot 2018-03-26 at 6.46.51 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Add back the custom field with the same name and edit the JQL. Once done, delete back the custom field.
fields.summary: Unable to edit report series JQL if one series JQL is invalid.

fields.description: Provide a way to get and set the Customer Request Type value (and string representation) for a given Request Type in the public Java API.
fields.summary: Expose the Customer Request Type value for API use

fields.description:
*Summary*

In the same instance, if you had a user with an Atlassian Account in your user management and you deleted that user. You then choose to add this user as a customer in your Service Desk project by providing a customer portal invitation. The customer will be able to create the account but the moment the customer tries to login the customer will be kicked out, with the error message: *"Sorry, your email* or *password are incorrect - please try again."*

 

 

*Steps to Reproduce*
 # Create a user (xyz@atlassian.net) via the *User Management* invitation in the *User* tab. 
 # Once the invitation is received, login the account and go through the account creation process for the *Atlassian Account*. 
 # Once the user is able to login in to the instance as a user, proceed to delete the user from the User Management page. 
 # Go to your Service Desk project > Customers > Add Customer > Send a portal invitation to the same email address as before (xyz@atlassian.net). 
 # Once the invitation is received, click on the portal invitation > create the account with a username and password
 # When logging in, you will get the error "Sorry, you email or password are incorrect - please try again."
!emailerror.png|width=411,height=359!
 # If you cross check each login failure for the customer portal account with the *Portal Only Customers* tab in the *User Management*, the "Current Failed Logins" will still show zero. 

 

 

 

*Expected Results*

To be able to login with the same email address used before as a Atlassian user account in the same instance as a customer account for Service Desk Portal related issue. 

 

*Actual Results*

Unable to login with the same email address used before as a Atlassian user account in the same instance as a customer account for Service Desk Portal related issue. You get thrown out with an error that you are using the wrong email address or password. 

 

*Workaround*

Contact *Atlassian Support* to perform the fix.
fields.summary: Deleted Atlassian Account Users Cannot Create a Customer Account With The Same Email Address

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Customer cannot signup on the portal if a deleted Atlassian Account with the same email previously existed on the tenant.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # create *standard* (non-portal, AtlassianID SSO) user with email _user@blah.com_
 # revoke access
 # remove user
 # attempt sign up as user via portal view with email _user@blah.com_
 # no portal account is actually created, the sign up email is never received by user despite UI saying it has sent.

h3. Expected Results

User receives signup email to activate their account.
h3. Actual Results

User doesn't receive signup email to activate their account.
h3. Workaround
 * Site admin can create the problematic customer accounts themselves via the public API [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/api-group-customer/.|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/api-group-customer/] Then user can signup again.
 * Problematic customer accounts can be added from the customers page in the project. Then user can signup again.
 * Add problematic customer accounts back as Atlassian Accounts in admin.atlassian.com but revoke all their product access. Then user can login using their Atlassian account.
fields.summary: Customer cannot signup on the portal if a deleted Atlassian Account with the same email previously existed

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When accessing Customer Portal via mobile browser or using Ipad , unable to scroll knowledge base article in pop up screen. 
h3. Environment
* Mobile
* Ipad

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open Customer portal using mobile browser or Ipad browse
# Then , open a form and fill up an aritcle name in Summary field ( Make sure it will suggest an article)
# Click the suggested article and it will pop up a screen with the context.


h3. Expected Results
Able to scroll the page.

h3. Actual Results
Unable to scroll the page
 
h3.Workaround
# Click the search icon at the top of the Customer Portal page.
# Search the KB.
# The article will open a full page and will be able to scroll it.
fields.summary: Unable to scroll knowledge base when using Mobile/ Ipad

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, issue's approver will be notified when a new issue is created and it's waiting for approval, however, the approver doesn't receive comments notifications if they don't click on *Get notifications* option at Portal.
h3. Suggestion

The better option would be to have the approver automatically get the updates and if they don’t wish to receive them they can opt out.
fields.summary: Approvers should get issue's notifications by default
